Subjective: Tired x 2 months, all day, wakes up tired. Onset unclear (gradual vs. sudden). Work: considered calling in sick, very tired end of day, does nothing. Weekends: resting. Sports (climbing 2-3x/week): possible, no muscle power loss. Cycling: daily, no dyspnea/acid reflux. Associated: Superficial sleep sometimes. Increased muscle pain, back pain. Morning stiffness. Wakes with startle (1x/week, lifelong). No clear cause. No specific illness. No dramatic physical condition deterioration. No specific joint pain (hands/feet). No snoring. No new respiratory issues/allergies (hay fever controlled). No palpitations, no chest pain. Eating normal, good appetite. Weight stable (72kg). Stools daily (3-4x/day), smooth, normal. Urination normal. Father with back problems. Request: Unsure if something wrong with body, especially with muscle pain; concerned about rheumatism; wants blood tests; wants to know if 'anything scary'.
Objective: Vitals: BP 110/60, HR 40-60 bpm. PE: Heart: RRR. Lungs: CTA bilaterally. Back: Pain on palpation lower back, paracentral. No pelvic pain with compression. Long back muscles: no tenderness, no asymmetry. Neck: full ROM, no pain. Shoulders: full ROM. Abdomen: Lively peristalsis. Tympanic/dull percussion. Supple, mild discomfort on deep palpation, no sharp pain. General: No gross abnormalities.
Assessment: Fatigue, unexplained. R/o: Anemia, Thyroid dysfunction, Inflammation. Less likely: Cardiac/pulmonary etiology, Rheumatoid arthritis (no specific joint pain).
Plan: Follow-up: Call day after blood test for phone appointment to discuss results and next steps.
Instructions: Form for blood test via inbox. Do not make appointment at Atal Medial.
